DOC.brief_summary: This study determine overall analgesic effect single oral dose etoricoxib compare ibuprofen participant moderate-to-severe primary dysmenorrhea .
DOC.brief_title: Study Assess Safety Efficacy Etoricoxib Versus Ibuprofen Treatment Dysmenorrhea ( MK-0663-145 AM1 )
DOC.detailed_description: Participants meet study entry criterion randomly allocate 2 possible sequence 2 treatment regimen course 2 menstrual cycle . In treatment sequence 1 , participant receive etoricoxib 120 mg daily menstrual cycle 1 , ibuprofen 2400 mg/daily menstrual cycle 2 . In treatment sequence 2 , participant receive ibuprofen 2400 mg/daily menstrual cycle 1 etoricoxib 120 mg daily menstrual cycle 2 .
DOC.criteria: Agree remain abstinent use doublebarrier contraception throughout study . Participants status post tubal ligation exempt requirement . Moderate severe primary dysmenorrhea minimum 4 previous 6 menstrual cycle . Moderate : Overthecounter analgesic provide significant relief menstrual cycle ; discomfort interfere usual activity . Severe : Overthecounter analgesic consistently effective , prescription analgesic require least menstrual cycle ; discomfort incapacitate cause inability work usual activity . Willing limit alcohol intake 2 drink equivalent per day duration study followup period well avoid exercise first 24 hour postdose menstrual cycle . Able read , understand , complete diary . Use intrauterine device . Pregnant , breast feeding , < 6 week postpartum . Active gastric ulcer history inflammatory bowel disease . Uncontrolled hypertension . Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus renal disease . Class IIIV congestive heart failure . Coronary artery bypass graft surgery , angioplasty , myocardial infarction , cerebrovascular accident transient ischemic attack within past 6 month . Unstable angina . Mild , moderate , severe hepatic insufficiency . Any personal family history inherit acquire bleed disorder . History neoplastic disease ; Exceptions : 1 ) adequately treat basal cell carcinoma carcinoma situ cervix ; 2 ) malignancy successfully treat > equal 5 year prior screen . Participants history leukemia , lymphoma , malignant melanoma , myeloproliferative disease ineligible study regardless time since treatment . Allergic etoricoxib , ibuprofen , acetaminophen , indomethacin , nonsteroidal antiinflammatory drug ( NSAIDs ) , cyclooxygenase ( COX ) 2 inhibitor , component Saridon ( propyphenazone/paracetamol/caffeine ) . Recent history chronic analgesic tranquilizer use dependence . Morbidly obese demonstrates significant health problem stem obesity . Current user recreational illicit drug recent history drug alcohol abuse dependence . Participated another clinical study within last 4 week . Not able swallow oral medication : surgical anatomical condition preclude swallow absorb oral medication ongoing basis .
